definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time

sentences.english: His fame spread throughout the country.
His senses dulled as the drug swept through his body.
sentences.chinese: 当毒素传遍他全身时，他的感觉变得麻木了。

sentences.english: Word of it has spread and you have dishonoured yourself here in Benares.
sentences.chinese: 此事传遍了贝拿勒斯，呆在这里你只有耻辱。

sentences.english: The good news ran through the whole town.
sentences.chinese: 这个好消息传遍了这个城镇。

sentences.english: The virus has such high infectivity that it soon spread to the whole area.
sentences.chinese: 这病毒传染性如此强，不久就传遍整个地区。

sentences.english: Her songs were spread about the streets in the mainland of the country.
sentences.chinese: 她的歌传遍祖国大陆的大街小巷。

sentences.english: You have over-heated temperature, has been spread from my back my whole body.
sentences.chinese: 你手上炽热的温度，一直从我的背部传遍我的全身。

sentences.english: She broadcast the gossip all over the town.
sentences.chinese: 她将这个流言传遍全镇。

sentences.english: Whale songs become "hits" that can spread halfway around the globe.
sentences.chinese: 鲸类们有自己的“流行歌曲”，它能传遍半个地球。

sentences.english: The news spread round the village rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息很快就传遍全村。

sentences.english: Gossip percolated through the country at large.
42This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 这事传遍了约帕，就有许多人信了主。

sentences.english: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
sentences.chinese: 他这事的风声就传遍了犹太，和周围地方。

sentences.english: The good news was flashed across [over] the country.
sentences.chinese: 好消息闪电般传遍全国。

sentences.english: The news spread throughout the country.
The name of the young singer resounded throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻歌手的名字传遍了全国。

definition: to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
